purpose: NixOS machine configuration for LINDA workstation, integrating hardware settings, environment modules, services, and custom optimizations for development, gaming, and media production.
exports: boot configuration with kernel modules and params
hardware settings for AMD CPU and NVIDIA GPU
nixos_patterns: boot.kernelModules and kernelParams for hardware tuning
integration_points: rclone-target for automated backups to minio
Autostart services for obsidian, dino, discord
VFIO for GPU passthrough in virtualization
notes: This machine configuration is highly customized for a high-performance workstation named LINDA, equipped with AMD Ryzen CPU, NVIDIA GPU, and ZFS storage pools. It imports numerous environment modules for development (code, neovim, emacs), gaming (steam), CAD/graphics/3D printing, communications, and more. Key features include VPN connectivity with postfix 88, automated rclone backups to obsidian-v3 every minute, Sunshine for remote gaming with open firewall ports, and custom systemd user services for autostarting applications like Obsidian, Dino (XMPP client), and Discord. Audio is managed via Pipewire with specific rules to block source volume for Discord and Vivaldi. Boot configuration includes VFIO modules for GPU passthrough, multiple video outputs with resolutions, and kernel params for AMD IOMMU and pstate. Firewall allows specific ports for gaming (Steam, Sunshine) and streaming. Disabled automatic nix GC to preserve cache. Includes Guix service and ADB for development workflows. Networking uses specific Ethernet interfaces with DHCP, hostname LINDACORE. Hardware settings enable 32-bit graphics support, NVIDIA power management, and SANE scanning. This setup indicates a versatile machine used for software development, media production, virtualization, and gaming, with strong emphasis on automation and performance optimization. Reasoning: The extensive imports and custom configurations suggest this is a primary development machine with integrated services for productivity, entertainment, and remote access. The presence of both development tools and gaming/streaming services points to a workstation used for professional work and leisure.
